title: Beach
description: A beach is a geological formation consisting of loose rock particles along the shoreline of a body of water.

title: Lake
description: A lake is an area of variable size filled with water, localized in a basin, that is surrounded by land, apart from any river or other outlet that serves to feed or drain the lake.

title: Prairie
description: Prairies are ecosystems considered part of the temperate grasslands, savannas, and shrublands biome by ecologists, based on similar temperate climates, moderate rainfall, and a composition of grasses, herbs, and shrubs, rather than trees, as the dominant vegetation type.

title: The scenery
description: The natural features of a landscape considered in terms of their appearance, especially when picturesque.

title: Sunset
description: Sunset or sundown, is the daily disappearance of the Sun below the horizon as a result of Earth's rotation.

title: Joshua Tree
description: Two distinct desert ecosystems, the Mojave and the Colorado, come together in Joshua Tree National Park. A fascinating variety of plants and animals make their homes in a land sculpted by strong winds and occasional torrents of rain. Dark night skies, a rich cultural history, and surreal geologic features add to the wonder of this vast wilderness in southern California.

title: Iceberg
description: An iceberg or ice mountain is a large piece of freshwater ice that has broken off a glacier or an ice shelf and is floating freely in open water.
